messages.message: is there anyone who could help troubleshoot or knows how to fix this issue? when I try to run instabase locally, docker hyperkit (?) hogs all my RAM making my laptop really slow basically unusable. Are there any settings I don’t know of that I can change? I assigned 8 gb of memory to docker. don’t think its related but docker is up to date and i ran prune all (since i didn’t have space anymore for docker) before trying to run instabase..
Docker leaks pretty aggressively on mac :( does it get better for a while when you quit docker and restart it?
sounds like we should support linuxbooks :sunglasses:
Or buying laptops with more than 16GB of RAM :upside_down_face:
That's been the standard for half a year or so
Oh, cool!
It's us OGs that go without. :)
o true — i didn’t even notice (got laptop switched out bc old webcam broke ~4 months back)
oof, i need me one of theeeese
I’ve noticed that if I lower the memory allowed for docker, it actually is faster and doesn’t take up all of your ram
Orrrr…. https://www.apple.com/mac-pro/ :smirk:
@Eric Han what do you set it to? like 6?
my settings
I'll never buy a mac pro again
Or recommend one.
lolwut @Eric Han i remember having it on 1gb in my first month and instabase and not being able to run anything
More seriously, I also have mine limited to 2GB, but I don’t generally run the entire stack at once.
It depends on what you are running at once @Felicia
:man-shrugging: I don’t do a lot of heavy app tasks work
what do you mean @will? i run everything except celery flower, stanford nlp, docops, most of my stuff needs to be tested in app tasks and i run that with build reload
The more services you run the more memory you may need (and docker may leak). Maybe try setting it to 4GB and see if that helps?
@will i’ll set it to 4gb and see if that works :slightly_smiling_face:

@will you got a mac pro before? :open_mouth: haha. but yeah my computer struggles really hard when i restart all the tasks. I had issues with memory before with pdf service oom-ing, so I had to increase it. Mine’s set at 6 gb though

I bought one in a previous life, yeah. I'm still emotionally scarred, but the short version was somehow I ended up on the only computer they started phasing out support for a year after they rolled it out.

I got a lot of use out of it anyway, but everything was an uphill battle because they didn't treat it like a first class citizen once the trashcan came out... and they didn't support really support  the trashcan either.
It still works great but can't really upgrade it past high sierra even with a modern gpu. I only use it as a DAW and dev box now (and occasionally a game).
the 4gb limit seems to work, thank you @will :slightly_smiling_face:
